description:
Cluster Edge Academy isn't just any school; it's THE school, where the offspring of the elite come together to prepare for their roles running a world where artificial soldiers and religious sects are major factors in the battle for total control. Which may be part of why new transfer student Agate Fluorite doesn't quite seem to fit in. It's not just that Agate's enthusiastic attitude stands out among the somber, brooding balance of the student body. There's something about him that demands notice, even from jaded honors students like Beryl Jasper, and from the moment of arrival he's been at the center of a series of mysteries that not even Agate understands. Because Agate's not just another student, he's part of a something so momentous, and dangerous, that the world that built Cluster Edge may not survive its passing.

(Source: Sentai Filmworks)

tags.name: Primarily Male Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of male characters.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Fugitive
tags.description: Prominently features a character evading capture by an individual or organization.

tags.name: Religion
tags.description: Centers on the belief that humanity is related to supernatural, transcendental, and spiritual elements.

tags.name: Memory Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features a character(s) who has had their memories altered.

tags.name: Gods
tags.description: Prominently features a character of divine or religious nature.

tags.name: Military
tags.description: Centered around the life and activities of military personnel.

tags.name: Aviation
tags.description: Regarding the flying or operation of aircraft.

tags.name: Terrorism
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a terrorist or terrorist organization.

tags.name: War
tags.description: Partly or completely set during wartime.

tags.name: Politics
tags.description: Centers around politics, politicians, or government activities.

node.description: [Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/970932685693571072)

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E6%B1%A0%E7%94%B0%E6%88%90)

Masashi Ikeda is a director, screenwriter and storyboard artist.

Noted for directing [Mobile Suit Gundam Wing](https://anilist.co/anime/90/), [Vampire Hunter](https://anilist.co/anime/1952/) and the first 44 episodes of [Inuyasha](https://anilist.co/anime/249/). He is a former member of an amateur anime production circle "Group Ebisen," together with [Hiroyuki Kakudou](https://anilist.co/staff/141183/), [Kouji Yamamura](https://anilist.co/staff/101065/), [Keiko Fukuyama](https://anilist.co/staff/159650/), [Sunao Katabuchi](https://anilist.co/staff/103947/), [Umanosuke Iida](Umanosuke Iida) and Takuya Ishida.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E6%B1%A0%E7%94%B0%E6%88%90)

Masashi Ikeda is a director, screenwriter and storyboard artist.

Noted for directing [Mobile Suit Gundam Wing](https://anilist.co/anime/90/), [Vampire Hunter](https://anilist.co/anime/1952/) and the first 44 episodes of [Inuyasha](https://anilist.co/anime/249/). He is a former member of an amateur anime production circle "Group Ebisen," together with [Hiroyuki Kakudou](https://anilist.co/staff/141183/), [Kouji Yamamura](https://anilist.co/staff/101065/), [Keiko Fukuyama](https://anilist.co/staff/159650/), [Sunao Katabuchi](https://anilist.co/staff/103947/), [Umanosuke Iida](Umanosuke Iida) and Takuya Ishida.
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/木村絵理子)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/58120205)

Originating from [Sunrise](https://anilist.co/studio/14/).

He first came to prominence as the director who overtook [Shinji Takamatsu](https://anilist.co/staff/100152/) on [Gintama](https://anilist.co/anime/918/) from episode 100 onwards. He stepped down from the role after the [2013 movie](https://anilist.co/anime/15335/), but remained as a supervisor for the series until the end.

Also known for series such as [Osomatsu-san](https://anilist.co/anime/21261/) and [Binbougami ga!](https://anilist.co/anime/13535/).

__[Profile (Imagine)](https://www.imagine-music.co.jp/artist/index/10)__

__Birthplace:__ Tokyo, Japan

__Takayuki Negishi__ is a Japanese guitarist, composer, arranger and music producer affiliated with Imagine Music, better known for his composition work on several anime, such as; the hit magical girl TV series Cardcaptor Sakura, Tokyo Mew Mew and Mnemosyne. He began working in the industry as a synthesizer operator in 1983, before he later became a composer. He also produces music for several  artists like Mariko Nagai and Hiroko Moriguchi.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/98020267)

Yamada graduated from the Department of Literature at Keio University. While attending the university he was in the same year as the Macross character designer [Haruhiko Mikimoto](https://anilist.co/staff/96968/) and creator [Shouji Kawamori](https://anilist.co/staff/97501/), both of which where the first people he collaborated with in [The Super Dimension Fortress Macross](https://anilist.co/anime/1088//). This marked the start of his scriptwriting career.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E6%B1%A0%E7%94%B0%E6%88%90)

Masashi Ikeda is a director, screenwriter and storyboard artist.

Noted for directing [Mobile Suit Gundam Wing](https://anilist.co/anime/90/), [Vampire Hunter](https://anilist.co/anime/1952/) and the first 44 episodes of [Inuyasha](https://anilist.co/anime/249/). He is a former member of an amateur anime production circle "Group Ebisen," together with [Hiroyuki Kakudou](https://anilist.co/staff/141183/), [Kouji Yamamura](https://anilist.co/staff/101065/), [Keiko Fukuyama](https://anilist.co/staff/159650/), [Sunao Katabuchi](https://anilist.co/staff/103947/), [Umanosuke Iida](Umanosuke Iida) and Takuya Ishida.

After having graduated from Tokyo Designer Gakuin, she joined [Sunrise](https://anilist.co/studio/14/), and started off as an animator. She is noted as the first female mecha director, and one of the few female directors in the '80s alongside [Makoto Moriwaki](https://anilist.co/staff/109581/) and [Hiroko Tokita](https://anilist.co/staff/101903/).
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/須永司)

[Twitter](https://x.com/yonetanikantoku)

Yoshitomo Yonetani was born  in Tokyo and graduated Tokyo Designer Gakuin. He is the leader of Studio 7 at Sunrise and was responsible for their super robot cult series Yuusha Ou GaoGaiGar as well as Brigadoon and Betterman.

Yoshitomo was inspired working in the animation industry after having seen Mirai Shounen Conan.

He started as production assistent at Toei Douga, before moving to Shin-Ei Douga and finally Sunrise.

Other than anime director he is also a song writer for several anime series and sings anime themes under the name of ※-mai.
Initially an animator at [Telecom Animation Film](https://anilist.co/studio/94/).
Also wrote a few scripts right before retiring from the industry.
